								So I gathered up 4 friends, load up SteamVR and start the World VR Competition. I had already tried the game by myself earlier so I knew that this could be a fun experience and competition between us. Everyone was enjoying the game a lot! Although I had some critique to do. My favorite game was by far the light saber one, cutting the balls shot at you is deff satisfying!! I was having a blast but then I realised I could no get near the top scores, and that's because you don't actually need to perform a cutting motion, just pointing the blade torwards the ball is enough and by doing this I was able to be in the top 5. I would actually prefer that everyone on the leaderboards were trying to cut the ball, so this would be really nice of an update. Still had tons of fun with it. It is as addicting as I thought it would be, I kept persuing the top 5 for each one of the games! :o) Once you finish a game, would be great to have the option to try again, rather than going back to start screen and having to select the game again.  :D

												World VR Competiton excels in it's simplicity and allows for anyone to pick up and play with hours of enjoyment on end for groups of people.I played with 3 other friends and the ability for us to create our own character at the very beginning was a welcome addition to the experience and gave the title it's own uniqueness.  I have yet to see another VR game do this.  As for the games, each one had it's own mechanic and it's own difficulty curve that made each one feel different, challenging, but yet rewarding all on it's own.  Since each mini game has it's own unique/different objective it was very interesting to see one friend suck at one game, but be the master at another.  This, in turn, created a fun competitive atmosphere in the room as we watched the medal count change after every game.My personal favorite mini game was the trap shooting due to it's difficulty.  One friend's favorite was the boxing as he came close to beating the wrold record.  Another friend enjoyed the sniping as he had to account for travel time.  This goes to show that there is something for everyone in this game. That aside, this game is a perfect party game if you want to have friends over.  Reminds me of the good 'ol Nintendo 64 days where people actually had to come over and play.  TL;DR  Having multiple people come over for VR and play 15 minute games at a time is a drag.  This allows everyone to quickly jump in and jump out and has a great competitive pace to it.  Recommend.
